          My research is guided by leveraging the inherent adaptability
          in human mental processes to improve mental health.
          Interdisciplinarity is key to me, drawing from my background
          in cognitive neuroscience & clinical psychology.
          
          
          I employ diverse methodological approaches. Some projects use
          emerging technologies like AR/VR to
          introduce novel interventions, while others utilize a translational
          approach to develop innovative treatments.
          
          
          I present my research at scientific conferences. Next
          presentaions will be at the Deutscher
          Psychotherapie Kongress and the DGPs/ÖGP
          Congress 2024.
          
          
          I accept media inquiries (e.g. from the SRF),
          invited talks for clinicians (e.g. Privatklinik
          Wyss) contribute to educational programs for the general
          public, such as at the Brain
          Week or give courses at the volkshochschule
          beider basel.
          
          
          I am an active member of the working group of the German
          Psychological Society on Open Science in Clinical Psychology.
          See here our latest paper.

          projects
          
            
        

        
          
      
      
        
          Prinicipal Investigator
          VALPRO
          
          The randomized-controlled trial tested whether the combination
          of valproic acid with fear memory retrieval before standard
          exposure enhances the treatment outcome for patients with fear
          of spiders. Key collaborating partners were Prof. Dr. Johannes
          Gräff, the clinic director of the Psychiatric University
          Clinics Basel Prof. Dr. Undine
          Lang and Prof. Dr. Dominique
          de Quervain. Click here for the preregristration on ClinicalTrials.gov
          and first
          results. The research report is currently under peer
          review, check out later for updates.
          
          Hypothalamic-pituitary-adrenal axis functioning in
          anxiety disorders
          
          With a meta-analytic approach, we summarize the current state
          of research on the functionality of the
          hypothalamic-pituitary-adrenal axis in anxiety disorders. Key
          collaborating partner is Dr. Susanne
          Fischer from the University of Zurich. Click here for the
          PROSPERO
          preregistration.
          
          Hormones, conduct disorder, and callous-unemotional
          traits
          
          With a meta-analytic approach, we investigate the
          relationships between hormones and callous-unemotional traits,
          as well as conduct disorder, in children and adolescents.
          Co-Principal investigator is Dr. Loreen
          Tisdall form the University of Basel. Click here for the
          PROSPERO
          preregistration.
          
          Common triggers of contamination obsessive-compulsive
          symptoms
          
          In the project we collected common triggers of contamination
          obsessive-compulsive symptoms (OCS) in a large Swiss
          population, along with the trigger severity, as well as the
          intensity of the obsessive-compulsive symptoms. We analyzed
          the collected information with an approach using large
          language models, and generated a map of OCS triggers by
          assessing their similarity through embeddings. Key
          collaborating partner is Dr. Dirk
          Wulff from the Max Planck Institute for Human Development,
          Berlin, Germany.
          
          Mental representations of contamination
          obsessive-compulsive triggers
          
          The project aims to characterize contamination
          obsessive-compulsive stimuli based on theoretically guided
          dimensions as well as data-driven dimensions.
          Methodologically, similarity judgment is used to identify
          underlying dimensions, which are then analyzed using
          multidimensional scaling. The results have the potential to
          guide the development of new treatment approaches. Key
          collaborating partner is Dr. Filip Melinscak
          and the clinic director of the Psychiatric Hospital PD
          Dr. Steffi Weidt.
          
          Co-investigator
          OCD-Detect
          
          The project investigates the feasibility and acceptance of the
          use of a wearable for automatic detection of compulsive
          hand-washing in a clinical population with
          obsessive-compulsive disorder. Principal investigator of the
          project is PD.
          Dr. Karina Wahl from the University of Basel.

Dorothée Bentz, PhD

          teaching
          
            
        

        
          
      
      
        
          
          I have supervised 23 master’s students and 14 bachelor’s
          students at the Faculty of
          Psychology, University of Basel.
          
          
          I have taught courses at the intersection of clinical
          psychology, neuroscience, and new
          technologies at the bachelor’s, master’s, and PhD level.
          Since 2022, I have been developing the curriculum for PhD
          program Health & Interventions.
          
          
          In my courses, I place great importance on practical
          application as well as the development of scientific
          core competencies and the expansion of individual
          skills. In the PhD
          program Health & Interventions, I also specifically
          design and teach workshops on scientific core competencies,
          career development, and Open Science, and
          moderate the colloquium
          of the PhD
          program Health & Interventions.
          
          
          In 2023, with Prof. Dr. Tara
          Donker (University of Freiburg, Germany) and Dr. Loreen
          Tisdall (University of Basel), I secured a Cross-Border
          Education Grant that allowed us to implement a bi-national
          workshop on the topic of Innovative Technologies in
          Psychological Science with PhDs and Postdocs from both
          universities.
          
          
          Here you will find an automated
          list of my current and upcoming courses that I have taught
          or organized for the PhD
          program Health & Interventions.
